searchDocs.title: OnAdded​
searchDocs.content: </> Wrapper.OnAdded: Signal When an instance gets an object applied into Wrapper.

searchDocs.title: OnRevoked​
searchDocs.content: </> Wrapper.OnRevoked: Signal When an instance gets an object revoked from Wrapper.

searchDocs.title: new​
searchDocs.content: </> Wrapper.new( Class: Class<T>?, Tag: string, Options: Options? ) → Wrapper<T> Instantiates a new Wrapper object.

searchDocs.title: GetAll​
searchDocs.content: </> Wrapper.GetAll(self: Wrapper<T>) → {[Instance ]: T} Returns all of the currently tracked objects.

searchDocs.title: GetObject​
searchDocs.content: </> Wrapper.GetObject( self: Wrapper<T>, Inst: Instance ) → T? Gets the object associated with the given instance. local object = wrapper:GetObject(someInstance) object:DoSomething()

searchDocs.title: GetObjectByGUID​
searchDocs.content: </> Wrapper.GetObjectByGUID( self: Wrapper<T>, GUID: string ) → T? Gets the object associated with the given GUID. local guid = "342dcb0a-11b0-4119-abd8-ef8a100816b4" local object = wrapper:GetObjectByGUID(guid) object:DoSomething()

searchDocs.title: AwaitObject​
searchDocs.content: </> Wrapper.AwaitObject( self: Wrapper<T>, Inst: Instance , Timeout: number? ) → Promise Method that returns a Promise for when an object may not be loaded. wrapper:AwaitObject(someInstance) :andThen(function(object) object:DoSomething() end) :catch(warn)

searchDocs.title: Call​
searchDocs.content: </> Wrapper.Call( self: Wrapper<T>, Object: T, Method: string, ...: any ) → any Calls a method on the object corresponding with the given instance. You can pass any parameters you'd like after the object and the method name. Note Setting Debug to true in the options parameter in the constructor will have this method use debug warns. local object = wrapper:GetObject(someInstance) wrapper:Call(object, "DoSomething")

searchDocs.title: CallAll​
searchDocs.content: </> Wrapper.CallAll( self: Wrapper<T>, Method: string, ...: any ) → () Calls a method on all objects. local randomVariable = 10 wrapper:CallAll("DoSomething", randomVariable)

searchDocs.title: Apply​
searchDocs.content: </> Wrapper.Apply( self: Wrapper<T>, Inst: Instance ) → T? Creates a new object for an instance. It will call the constructor method of the object and give pass in the instance, trove, and optionally a GUID. local object = wrapper:Apply(someInstance) if object then object: DoSomething() end

searchDocs.title: Revoke​
searchDocs.content: </> Wrapper.Revoke( self: Wrapper<T>, Inst: Instance ) → () Cleans up an object. Note This will nullify the object's metatable, so you will not be able to use the object after revoking it from Wrapper. local object = wrapper:Apply(someInstance) -- cleans up the instance in the wrapper wrapper:Revoke(someInstance) -- you could also destroy the instance, thereby invoking the tag removed event someInstance:Destroy -- also cleans up

searchDocs.title: RevokeAll​
searchDocs.content: </> Wrapper.RevokeAll(self: Wrapper<T>) → () Revokes all wrapped objects.

searchDocs.title: Destroy​
searchDocs.content: </> Wrapper.Destroy(self: Wrapper<T>) → () Destroys all tracked objects, cleans the trove object and all signals, rendering this object useless. Metatable Removal Running this will make any further attempts to call a method of Wrapper error. wrapper:Destroy()
